violations.description: The person-in-charge shall ensure that equipment and utensils are designed, constructed and maintained to accomplish the intended and required functions [10.15.03.15A(3)(a)]. Freezer not maintained, ice build-up inside freezer OBSERVED ICE BUILDUP IN CHEST FREEZER IN BACK

The person-in-charge shall ensure that food temperature measuring devices are used to monitor the temperature of potentially hazardous foods; graduated and accurate within plus or minus 2°F; calibrated annually or more frequently; and cleaned and sanitized between uses indifferent foods to prevent cross-contamination [10.15.03.09A]. Thermometer provided but not used THERMOMETERS ARE PLACED IN UNITS IN FACILITY BUT ARE NOT BEING USED TO CHECK TEMPERATURES AS PART

(1) The person-in-charge shall ensure that the HACCP plan includes the identification of each CCP; critical limits for each CCP; monitoring procedures at each CCP; corrective action that will be taken if there is a loss of control at a CCP due to employee error, equipment malfunction, power failure, or any other factor that causes loss of control at a CCP; verification procedures that will ensure proper monitoring of each CCP; written procedures for employee training in HACCP plan procedures; and a list of the food service equipment that will be used at each CCP [10.15.03.33E]. HACCP plan does not include written procedures for employee training in HACCP plan procedures HACCP PLAN ON FILE DOES NOT INCLUDE STATEMENT IN HOW EMPLOYEES ARE HACCP TRAINED. SEND TRAINING Site: [] (2) The person-in-charge of a high or moderate priority food service facility shall ensure that an employee involved in food preparation is trained in the HACCP procedures [10.15.03.34B]. All employees involved in food preparation has not been trained in the HACCP procedures EMPLOYEES ARE NOT ROUTINELY TAKING TEMPERATURES UPON DELIVERY OF FOOD ITEMS AND EVERY 2 HOURS

The person-in-charge shall ensure that wiping cloths are rinsed and stored in one of the approved sanitizing solutions when used wet for wiping spills from the surfaces of equipment [10.15.03.16N(3)]. Soak all wiping cloths in a sanitization solution in between use. Wiping cloths are not being stored in the provided sanitization solution OBSERVED WIPING CLOTHS LAYING OUT ON PREP TABLE.

(1) The person-in-charge shall ensure that effective control measures are used to eliminate rodents, flies, roaches, and other vermin from the building [10.15.03.20E(1)]. Evidence of rodent infestation OBSERVE RAT DROPPINGS UNDER THE BAR SINK. CLEAN ALL DROPPINGS UP DAILY, SANITIZE ALL AREAS WHERE DROPPINGS ARE FOUND. CONTACT PEST CONTROL SERVICE TO TARGET ALL PEST ISSUES. LAST SERVICE WAS CONDUCTED ON 10/28/2025. PEST CONTROL SERVICES (2) The person-in-charge shall ensure that openings into the building are effectively protected against the entrance of insects and rodents [10.15.03.20E(3)(a)]. The person-in-charge shall ensure that potentially hazardous food is thawed in a refrigerated unit that does not exceed 41°F; under potable running water that is at or below 70°F or below with sufficient force to agitate and float off loose particles; in the microwave only when the food will be immediately cooked or immediately transferred to conventional cooking facilities as part of a continuous cooking process [10.15.03.09D]. Thaw all frozen foods by one of the approved methods. SHRIMP THAWING AT ROOM

Complaint Details : SR# 397967 COMPLAINANT STATES WORKERS DO NOT WEAR HAIR RESTRAINTS OR GLOVES. AND OLD COFFEE IS STORED IN JARS, OLD FOOD IS ADDED TO Observations : AT THE TIME OF INVESTIGATION ALL EMPLOYEES REQUIRED TO WEAR GLOVES AND HAIR RESTRAINTS WERE WEARING THEM. FACILITY DOES NOT KEEP OLD COFFEE, ONE POT IS HELD WARMING WHILE ANOTHER POT IS BREWING. FACILITY MAKES FOOD FOR CUSTOMERS TO ORDER. SOME FOODS ARE COOKED, COOLED, THEN REHEATED AND HOT HELD ON THE GRILL FOR QUICK SERVICE SUCH AS SCRAPPLE AND BACON.

The person in charge shall ensure that while displaying and serving food during pauses in food preparation or dispensing, utensils such as scoops, spoons, and dippers are stored in a running water dipper well, in hot water that is maintained at 135°F or above, with the handle above the top of the food , on a clean and sanitized portion of the food preparation or cooking equipment, or in a clean, protected location if the utensils are used with a food that is not potentially hazardous [10.15.03.06C(7)]. Store food preparation and dispensing utensils properly to protect against possible contamination. Utensils not stored above the top of the food or on a clean, dry surface ICE SCOOP HANDLE OBSERVED

Complaint Details : SR# 25-649750 COMPLAINANT CONTRACTED SCOMBROID POISONING Observations : BLUEFIN TUNA IS RECEIVED FRESH, AND CHECKED FOR QUALITY/TEMPERATURE AT RECEIVING. IT IS THEN MOVED TO THE WALK IN COOLER FOR A COUPLE HOURS UNTIL IT IS CUT, PORTIONED, WRAPPED, AND LABELED. IT IS THEN FROZEN. PORTIONS ARE REMOVED FIRST IN FIRST OUT AND THAWED IN THE WALK IN COOLER OVERNIGHT. THE BLUEFIN TUNA IS MOVED TO THE SUSHI DISPLAY COOLER AND SERVED RAW AS SASHIMI. TUNA VENDOR IS TRUE WORLD FOODS. THERE IS ONE SHIPMENT/INVOICE (7/3) FROM 6/27 TO 7/27 CONTAINING BLUEFIN TUNA. ALL TUNA WAS OBSERVED TO BE HELD
